actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to establish procedures to regulate the manner in which the U.S. Postal Service may close post offices serving rural areas and small communities and towns.

summary.text: Small Post Office Preservation Act - Prohibits the United States Postal Service from closing any post office which serves a rural area or small town unless: (1) a majority of the persons regularly served by such post office approve the closing; (2) it establishes a rural station or branch which provides the same postal services as the post office and does not result in any change in the mailing address of persons served by such post office; or (3) it establishes a rural route to serve the area involved. Allows the Postal Service to establish a rural route as a substitute for an existing post office only upon making specified determinations.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to establish procedures to regulate the manner in which the U.S. Postal Service may close post offices serving rural areas and small communities and towns.
